Articles.Content:
I was very sad, in tremendously low spirits. Bought myself a lizard cub, just so that I got better. But there's a problem, I don't know how to take care of it. I need someone to teach me how to, urgently.

I'm already giving it diced eggs, but have already spent a lot of money

I ask you, does the lizard suckle? If the lizard suckles, I will find it very cool

Edited April 25, 2019 by Guest
Find small insects. Your little dragon should not have any trouble eating them.
Live crickets and small cockroaches should work for feeding. Also, many reptiles need a source of heat in part of their enclosure, like a heat lamp.

Get it a 'hot rock'... it will love you for it.
https://www.google.com/search?q=lizard+heating+rock&source=lnms&tbm=shop&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjylODOmvPhAhVBhOAKHQ9nDmsQ_AUIDigB&biw=1536&bih=732

Also, what kind of lizard is it?  That will help in making diet choices.  I used to keep a 5 banded skink (native to NJ), and I made sure his diet was as he would have in the wild.

On 4/25/2019 at 12:02 PM, Aperture Science said:

…I don't know how to take care of it. I need someone to teach me how to, urgently…

Whatever pet shop sold you your lizard should be able to provide you proper care information, and be able to recommend local veterinarians that can treat it.

If they can’t, then don’t shop there anymore and find someplace that can.
They need warmth (dry rock in a terrarium and an infrared lamp) and you can feed them mealworms which should be available in larger petstores.
